path: artifacts/YYDS Smart Contract Audit Report - QuillAudits.pdf

project_path.yyds: contracts/YYDS Smart Contract Audit Report - QuillAudits/yyds

findings.title: On-chain generated prices can be manipulated
findings.description: On-chain generated prices are susceptible to price manipulation.

findings.title: Improper token accounting
findings.description: In swapAndDividend(), YYDS tokens are swapped to their USDT equivalent via the uniswapV2Router.

findings.title: Use of two-step ownable
findings.description: If ownership transfer is not done appropriately, the current contract owner can renounce/transfer ownership, lose owner privileges, and lose the ability to burn tokens.

findings.title: Missing test cases
findings.description: The YYDS token contract does not have any test cases and has not shown any results of thoroughly testing the protocol before launch.

findings.title: No way to withdraw stuck tokens/BNB
findings.description: There could be tokens mistakenly sent into the YYDS token contract and will remain stuck there with no means to claim them.

findings.title: Outdated libraries
findings.description: The codebase is replete with old packages from libraries that have gotten updates and newer releases.

findings.title: Variables can be converted into immutable instead of constant
findings.description: For addresses and values that do not change after deployment, they can be stored as immutable values to reduce gas costs for reading from storage.

findings.title: Missing event emission
findings.description: Some of the contract functions that update the tokenâ€™s state do not emit events when called.

findings.title: Unlocked pragma (pragma solidity ^0.8.0)
findings.description: Contracts should be deployed with the same compiler version and flags that they have been tested with thoroughly.

findings.title: Functions guaranteed to revert can be marked payable
findings.description: Throughout the codebase, there are functions marked as onlyOwner. These functions are guaranteed to revert when a regular user tries to call them.

findings.title: Wrong comments
findings.description: Some lines of code (comments) do not match the codebase specs.
